#summary Description of parameters
#labels manual

=Parameters for entity finding and profiling=
Commands `ef` and `ep`.

==Obligatory parameters==

|| *Parameter* || *Description* || *Possible values* || *Related parameter(s)* || *See also* || 
|| `index` || Location of the Lemur/Indri index || (location) || || || 
|| `model` || Association finding model || `1` = Model 1 <br> `2` = Model 2 || || [Models] ||
|| `associationFile` || File with document-entity associations || (location) || `associationFileFormat` ||  || 
|| `queryFile` || File with queries (topics) || (location) || || FileFormats ||
|| `outputFile` || Output file || (location) || `outputFileFormat` || ||

==Optional parameters==
===All models===
|| *Parameter* || *Description* || *Possible values* || *See also* || 
|| `smoothingMethod` || Smoothing method || `dirichlet` = Dirichlet (default)<br>`jm` = Jelinek-Mercer || `smoothingParam` ||
|| `smoothingParam` || Smoothing parameter<br>(\beta for Dirichlet, \lambda for Jelinek-Mercer smoothing) || (real) || ||
|| `associationFileFormat` || Association file format || `0` (default), `1` .. `7` || FileFormats ||  
|| `entityAliasMapping` || File defining a mapping of `EntityAlias` values to `EntityID`-s.<br>Obligatory, when associationFileFormat is set to 2, 3, 6, or 7. || (location) || EntityRepresentation || 
|| `outputFileFormat` || Output file format || `0` (default), `1` || FileFormats ||  
|| `outputNum` || Number of results to output<br>(entities for entity finding, topics for entity profiling) || default: all results || ||
|| `runID` || runID for TREC style output files (`outputFileFormat=0`) || (string) || FileFormats ||

===Model 2 (only)===
|| *Parameter* || *Description* || *Possible values* || *See also* || 
|| `topDocNum` || Number of top relevant documents considered per query. <br>Default: consider all documents. || (positive int) || [Models] ||
|| `smoothSupportFile` || Smoothing support file, which can be generated by the Lemur application<br> `GenerateSmoothSupport`. The use of this smoothing support file is to store some<br> pre-computed quantities so that the scoring procedure can be speeded up. || (string) || ||
